fields.description:
The documentation for OnDemand should more clearly and speficially state what version control systems are supported in which ways by which application components of OnDemand.  For example, subversion is fully supported in all applications and Bamboo can build from svn source. However, GitHub users can only currently integrate with and update JIRA issues for the moment. 

Perhaps http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand would be an appropriate home for this information.
fields.summary: Add specific supported version control information to limitations and possibly FAQs

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Suppose in my dashboard I have some gadgets which are in the lower part of the dashboard.
3. Click edit from the gadget menu.

Result:
1. The focus is not on the open preferences dialog.
2. The page has scrolled up.

Expected:
1. The page focus should n't change. User should be able to view the preferences dialog.
fields.summary: Clicking on "Edit" menu option for any gadget placed in the lower part of the dashboard set focus back to the upper part of dashboard.

fields.description:
First bug logged with Jira itself & I don't know how to link directly to the bug in question, so please be gentle.  

Vail Resorts has a bug, LCVL-261, that has apparent formatting issues.  I'm working with Matt Steck, who is credited with the wierd looking update & strange attachments on 10/28/11 at 10:57am.  He added a comment to me, asking me to move it to another queue, and a bunch of extra, unwanted stuff subsequently appeared in the ticket.

Is this representative of an actual Jira problem?  I'm a seasoned QA person with programming & database experience & let me know if you need additional data.

I've attached a copy of the html, which I saved just in case the ticket changes on us.
fields.summary: Possible problem/wierd bug contents, for a Vail Resorts ticket

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- In a Jira 4.4.1#660 go to Administration -> Backup System
- Insert a new name from the file and click in "Backup"
- So take the file and place it in /data/jirastudio/webdav from a OnDemand Instance;
- Go to the Administration Page, tab "General" -> Import -> Jira Import. Click in Next.
- On the "Jira Export" box select the file you've previously sent to the webdav directory. Click in Next
- Confirm on "Start Import".

Current behavior:
OnDemand will parse the files, import to Postgres, Reindex and all, but in the end it will show the following message: 

"Unexpected error while restoring data: java.lang.RuntimeException: No primary instance of 'SVN' defined."

Expected behavior:
OnDemand will import the dump correctly.

Cheers,
Lucas Timm
fields.summary: JIRA Importer: No primary instance of 'SVN' defined

fields.description:
It's not the first time where users are talking about the Client Side message "Do you want to view only the webpage content that was delivered securely?" ;)

Opening the page of the Project the user related, we found(with help of the FireBug extension) that the link delivered without https is the "gravatar" link of the Activity Stream. It seems that this avatar integration, where the default avatar have a link to gravatar is giving the message that the Activity Stream gadget is unsecure.

Gravatar appears to run only under non-secure connections, so as additional question to this bugfix. Is there a way to remove this avatar integration? :S
fields.summary: IE 8 security warning due to non-HTTPS gravatar avatar integration

fields.description:
Usernames in JIRA have to be lowercase, but they can contain spaces. If you try to create an external (non-Google) user on a Google Apps-enabled instance that has a space in the username, it blows up with a stack trace:

{code:none}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.google.gdata.client.authn.oauth.OAuthException: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 68: https://apps-apis.google.com/a/feeds/<google apps domain>/user/2.0/<username>
	at com.atlassian.agmp.openid.users.mgmt.jira.UserServiceImpl.userExistsInGoogle(UserServiceImpl.java:529)
	at com.atlassian.agmp.integration.jira.action.AddUserInterceptor.isGoogleUser(AddUserInterceptor.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.agmp.integration.jira.action.AddUserInterceptor.interceptDoExecute(AddUserInterceptor.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.peace.jira.ActionPeacekeeper.intercept(ActionPeacekeeper.java:46)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:27)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:205)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:143)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:152)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
{code}
fields.summary: Stack trace occurs when trying to create external user with spaces in username on Google Apps-enabled instance

fields.description:
The Jira Studio is wrongly formatting the "--" separator.

We need to create a new service (Administration > System > Service) setting as handler 'RegexCommentHandler'. As you want to reply notifications and add new comments on issues, the mail account set on the POP mail server must be the same set on the SMTP mail server. Both mails servers you set at Administration > Global Settings > Mail Servers).

Regarding the handler parameters, we want to set something like bellow:

project=SPR, bulk=forward, splitregex=/-+\s*Original Message\s*-+/

This way the mail handler will split the message when it founds the message you added on the 'splitregex' parameter. Notice that this handler does not work with HTML mail messages.

It was already fixed in Jira Standalone.
fields.summary: Email handler doesn't respect signature separator (--)

Current behavior: The issue will not be listed due the "not" word. If you search again with the keywords "Upload Speed slider does" the same issue will be displayed as well.
fields.summary: The keyword "not" is dropping the results in Jira Studio search engine

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Create group name ABC
# Assign a user to group ABC
# Create a project 
# In the SVN permission manager, remove every permission from the project's repository
# Add ABC to read permission to the project's repository
# Access the repository as the user. You will get 403 Forbidden error.

Workaround:
Do not use group name with capital letters
fields.summary: SVN auth does not respect group name with capital letters

fields.description:
This is possible on the Standalone enviroiment however the same process is not applicable on JIRA Studio.

In example:

If you create a "Test" project and associate a permission scheme which grants the project lead to have the "Administer Projects" on it, so if this user goes into the administration section he will only be able to see and edit the project that he is the project lead (other projects will be hidden).

The same procedure as described above is not applicable into Studio because the user needs to be part of the "administratos" group in order to access the project administration page.
fields.summary: Unable to set permission for a user to edit a project.

fields.description:
This weird case started to occur after the August Release. This is the situation:

* The user is member of some groups. Example:
** Example1 belongs to Group1(bugged), Group2 and Group3. Example2 is member of the same groups.
* You remove the user Example1 from the group Group1 through User Browse(Studio Jira). No matter if you do this through the User edit or Group edit screens.
* The user is removed from the group on the cwd_membership on Crowd database, but not from the cwd_membership on Jira db.
* Sync Jira with the remote dir(Studio Crowd) will not update the membership on Jira;
* It occurs with a specific GROUP. If Example1 and Example2 got removed from the Group1, the same thing will happen. Group2 wouldn't reproduce so, isn't a behavior "spread" on all groups or focused on a specific user.
* You add them again to group1. cwd_membership is updated on Crowd however JiraDB remains untouched.
 
In other cases the membership is duplicated on Jira database.
fields.summary: Jira cwd_membership group permission doesn't sync with Studio Crowd

fields.description:
Customers are getting lost in the JIRA UI.  When they click on the 'Administer Project' link, they expect to get taken to https://(instancename).jira.com/plugins/servlet/project-config/(projectkey)?scope=issues so they can edit the JIRA Project:
!Screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!


However, they are taken to the JIRA Studio project configuration section in admin and are now lost.

Steps to reproduce:

* You must part of administrator project role in any project;
!Screenshot.png|thumbnail!

* Go to the project Page -> Summary, there you will see the option *Administer Project*;
!Screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

* After clicking on the *Administer Project* option you will be sent to the next page;
!Screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

From here you'd need to know that you must click on the 'Configure' link next to the line about JIRA.
fields.summary: Administer project link is causing confusion

fields.description:
Similar to https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-741.

{{ContextPathToApplicationInstanceTranslator.destroy()}} may attempt to resolve the ApplinksManager service, which is impossible if the plugin system is shutting down (e.g. during an import) and the AppLinks service has already been disabled. The consequence is a 30s pause while Spring DM retries to resolve the service, and messages like this in the log: 
{noformat}
011-09-23 19:39:04,883 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR sysadmin 1178x35x1 1dbmgy2 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [internal.util.concurrent.RunnableTimedExecution] Closing runnable for context NonValidatingOsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.studio.studio-theme-jira-plugin, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml) did not finish in 10000ms; consider taking a snapshot and then shutdown the VM in case the thread still hangs
{noformat}

Solutions may be Spring configuration to modify timeouts, or more intelligence in {{ContextPathToApplicationInstanceTranslator.destroy()}}.

Thread dump pointing to {{ContextPathToApplicationInstanceTranslator.destroy()}} attached.
fields.summary: ContextPathToApplicationInstanceTranslator.destroy() can significantly slow down imports

fields.description:
# In Google Apps administration console, suspend a Google user who has already been synchronised to Studio and activated. (This Google user has logged into Studio as both Google user and external user at least once before the suspension.)
# Re-sync Google accounts in Studio.
# Notice that the user was "disabled" in Studio - its group membership was cleared and access level set to "No Access", and it was marked as an external user.
# Restore the user in Google Apps administration console and re-sync Google accounts in Studio.
# Notice that a user name conflict for that user occurred in Studio.
# Resolve the conflict in Studio.
# Notice that the user was marked as Google user again. Manually restore its original group membership and access level.
# Login as the user to Studio via Google. The login was successful, and the user was _not_ asked to set its Studio password.
# Login as the user to Studio as an external user using its original Studio password. The login failed. Studio says "_Sorry, your username and password are incorrect - please try again._"
fields.summary: User loses Studio password after being suspended and then restored in Google

fields.description:
The following scenario is needed to reproduce this error

* The user reach the max users allowed on a Studio instance;
* Accessing the user browser screen(secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa) with an Administrator(not system-administrator) user the following message is shown:
** Adding a new user will exceed the number of users allowed to use JIRA under your license. New users will be created without the 'JIRA Users' permission, and thus will not be allowed to log in to JIRA. 
* The "Your License" words when clicked send the user to the link ViewLicense(/secure/admin/ViewLicense!default.jspa) which needs a system-administrators group member to access it.
* The user access the link with an Administrator account, an get the message:
{code}
It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform.
If you think this message is wrong, {0}.
{code}

Solutions:
* Remove this link :P
* Send the user to the page Studio Administration page (secure/admin/StudioAdministration.jspa) instead of ViewLicense page to verify license issues.
fields.summary: Your License page not allowed to Administrator users.

fields.description:
The user _bamboo-svn-user is missing on studio-nightly. --It's possible that a development build, at some stage, caused the user to be removed or failed to add it after a clean install.-- The underlying problem is that the {{bamboo-svn-password}} attribute is missing from {{init.xml}} on this instance. Confirmed with Ernest that the attribute was added relatively recently (1 month ago). So instances created over 1 month ago (and therefore do not have the attribute) and clean installed with more recent versions of Studio (which expect the attribute) will not have _bamboo-svn-user.

Nonetheless: the user is currently created in Crowd upgrade {{UpgradeTo_v3}} task, which will only run once after a clean install or an upgrade from an old version. If this fails, nothing will create the user further down the line. Since we always want this user to be present, it would make sense to create it in a {{LifecycleAware.onStart()}} task, so that it always gets created on startup if it is missing.

One complexity with this is that the bamboo-svn-password must be retrieved from initial data. Strictly speaking, it is only safe to retrieve initial data when a clean instance is coming up and is configuring itself for the first time.
fields.summary: Move creation of _bamboo-svn-user to from upgrade task to lifecycle task, so that it is more robust.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Go into project overview of Studio project ({{/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project key>/summary}}).
# Change the FishEye Repository, Subversion Repository, and Repository Path all to "None".
# View a JIRA issue within that project and notice that the "Source" tab still shows (down the bottom, next to "All", "Comments", "Worklog", etc.).

If there's no associated FishEye repository, I'd not expect the Source tab to show up in the issue. It correctly doesn't appear along the Studio tabs at the top.
fields.summary: Source tab shouldn't be displayed on JIRA view issue pages when there's no associated FishEye repository

fields.description: Since importing into JIRA is a destructive operation, it should export the existing data to a known location before starting the import, in case the support team needs to restore the previous data for some reason.
fields.summary: JIRA issues importer should take a backup before starting the import

fields.description:
When adding an external user, the system will check whether the username is already used in the Google domain. This is particularly important when background sync is disabled.

However, from time to time, the Google service may be down or returning error messages, the system should be resilient, and either allow the add user to pass through or display an error message instead of dumping the stack trace.
fields.summary: Error page is displayed when trying to add an external user while Google returns error

fields.description:
After creating an additional Subversion repo and associate it to a current project and setting the custom tab, when clicking in the new custom source tab ("Source (01)" as shown on Screenshot01) it will loses the association with the project on the top menu (Screenshot02). (screenshots attached for better understading)

This is seems to be a bug after the upgrade as I was able to do it before.
fields.summary: When clicking on a custom source tab it loses the association with the project on the top menu

fields.description:
Screen recording: http://screencast.com/t/8AId4lrh

- Create a new project
- Go to Wiki tab
- Create a new page
- Expand the History dropdown

*Expected*: The new page to be included

*Actual*: "<No history yet>"


The problem is that the request for the browse history is being cached by the browser for a month.

Request:
{code}
GET https://studio-107-8.jira-dev.com/plugins/servlet/studio/browsehistory?callback=historyCallback HTTP/1.1
Host: studio-107-8.jira-dev.com
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: https://studio-107-8.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/FEDE/Home
Cache-Control: no-cache
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Pragma: no-cache
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/13.0.782.220 Safari/535.1
Accept: text/javascript, application/javascript, */*
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate,sdch
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.8
Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.3
{code}

Response:
{code}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx
Date: Wed, 14 Sep 2011 07:03:02 GMT
Content-Type: text/javascript;charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-AREQUESTID: 1023x834x1
X-ASESSIONID: zs0kox
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
X-AUSERNAME: admin
Cache-Control: max-age=2419200
Expires: Wed, 12 Oct 2011 07:03:02 GMT
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Content-Length: 531
{code}

Subsequent page loads will retrieve the response from cache and not get the newest history from the server. 

Notes:
- The JIRA tab works around this by appending what looks like a random number to the URL so that the browser never gets a cache hit. (ie. GET https://studio-107-8.jira-dev.com/plugins/servlet/studio/browsehistory?callback=historyCallback&_=1315984635987 HTTP/1.1)
- Reproes for Wiki, Source and Reviews tabs (Builds was not verified)
- Also reproes on https://studio-107-8.jira-dev.com (107.8 fireball)
- [Test Session where issue was found|https://confxhtml.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=288948265]

fields.description:
used query: project = ADL AND issuetype in (Bug, Story,"Story (Draft)","Story (Defect)",Task) AND status in (Open, "In Progress", Reopened) AND fixVersion is not EMPTY ORDER BY Rank ASC

It seems that the issues (with an empty fix version) appearing in the result of the query were previously added to a version. As we removed the fix version of those issues we expect that they do not appear in the result set.

When requesting "fix version is EMPTY", those issues does not appear in the result set, which seems to be related.
fields.summary: As user when creating a filter with an advanced query and requesting "fixVersion is not EMPTY", I receive issues with WITH EMPTY fix version

fields.description:
[Several|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-4561] [layers|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5460] of flakyness have been fixed in TestCommitNotifications, but they continue to fail intermittently:
- https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-JOB1-899
- https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-JOB1-892
fields.summary: Fix flaky TestCommitNotifications.*()

fields.description:
Screen recording: http://screencast.com/t/q4dFEaewy

- Create a project
- In admin console go to "Issues" -> "Projects" -> the new project
- On a separate browser window logout the user (to simulate a session timeout)
- Click on "Projects"

*Expected*: Redirection to Login page

*Actual*: Null pointer exception (full stack trace attached)
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.studio.jira.web.action.admin.ViewIssuesProjectsViewPeacekeeper.shape(ViewIssuesProjectsViewPeacekeeper.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.peace.view.AbstractDomViewPeacekeeper.shape(AbstractDomViewPeacekeeper.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.peace.view.ViewPeacekeeperPageFilter.shape(ViewPeacekeeperPageFilter.java:49)
{code}

Note:
- Also reproes on Studio fireball 107.8 (currently in production)
fields.summary: NullPointerException when navigating to projects admin menu if session has timed out

fields.description:
Screen recording: http://screencast.com/t/Tvn5eMa34V

*Expected*: The "CVS Modules" config setting should not appear on the project screen

*Actual*: User can click on "Change" which takes him/her to a websudo confirmation page, which user cannot leave.
fields.summary: User should not be allowed to change the "CVS Modules" of a project

fields.description:
One of the Studio FishEye plugins logs ERROR-level messages about the studio.properties file being missing on Unicorn, despite the fact that it's not an error for this file to be missing and is, in fact, expected.

Note that it is an error for this file to be missing on Zeus.
fields.summary: FishEye incessantly complains about a missing studio.properties file on Unicorn

fields.description:
See attached picture

Notes:
- This occurs with any zoom level > 100% (the screen shot is exagerated to better see the gap)
- I don't have usability numbers for customers that run their browsers at a zoom level greater than 100%. Due to vision issues, I run my browser at 120% and this rendering diference is noticeable.
fields.summary: Tabs in header Studio have additional "black" space if browser is zoomed in (Chrome and Safari)
